trans-unit.source: cc|configure to order

seg-source.mrk: cc|configure to order

trans-unit.source: With cc|configure to order functionality, the item master can become a Master BOM and Checklists can be assigned to it. Formulas, functions and variables assigned in the Master BOM and Checklist work together to form a configuration, which is used to produce a BOM.

seg-source.mrk: With cc|configure to order functionality, the item master can become a Master BOM and Checklists can be assigned to it.
Formulas, functions and variables assigned in the Master BOM and Checklist work together to form a configuration, which is used to produce a BOM.

trans-unit.source: In cc|project, the checklists are processed in the Job Budget Calculation line by answering pre-defined questions. These answers are transferred to a Document BOM, which contains the selected configuration. Here, changes can be made prior to exploding the BOM in the Job Budget Calculation. Once exploded, budget information can be assigned and processed as usual in cc|project. The Document BOM can also be used to create Construction Orders and Production Orders in the Job Planning and Processing view.

seg-source.mrk: In cc|project, the checklists are processed in the Job Budget Calculation line by answering pre-defined questions.
These answers are transferred to a Document BOM, which contains the selected configuration.
Here, changes can be made prior to exploding the BOM in the Job Budget Calculation.
Once exploded, budget information can be assigned and processed as usual in cc|project.
The Document BOM can also be used to create Construction Orders and Production Orders in the Job Planning and Processing view.

trans-unit.source: This topic briefly describes the Master BOM, Checklist and Document BOM in cc|configure to order as well as the usage of each in the Job Budget Calculation, and the creation of Construction Orders in the Job Planning and Processing view. For detailed setup, configuration and usage information, refer to the current “cc|industry solution: discrete manufacturing” documentation.

seg-source.mrk: This topic briefly describes the Master BOM, Checklist and Document BOM in cc|configure to order as well as the usage of each in the Job Budget Calculation, and the creation of Construction Orders in the Job Planning and Processing view.
For detailed setup, configuration and usage information, refer to the current “cc|industry solution: discrete manufacturing” documentation.

trans-unit.source: Master BOM

seg-source.mrk: Master BOM

trans-unit.source: The Master BOM works according to the principle of the maximum BOM, which combines all valid options in a configuration. During the BOM calculation, the variables use formulas and rules to determine quantities, setup and run time, and if positions are valid.

seg-source.mrk: The Master BOM works according to the principle of the maximum BOM, which combines all valid options in a configuration.
During the BOM calculation, the variables use formulas and rules to determine quantities, setup and run time, and if positions are valid.

trans-unit.source: Checklist

seg-source.mrk: Checklist

trans-unit.source: The checklist is the interface between users and system. Since the checklist can provide its own logic, it ensures that only information examined and verified by the user is available for configuration.

seg-source.mrk: The checklist is the interface between users and system.
Since the checklist can provide its own logic, it ensures that only information examined and verified by the user is available for configuration.

trans-unit.source: Document BOM

seg-source.mrk: Document BOM

trans-unit.source: As previously stated, the master BOM and checklist work together to form a configuration, which is used to produce the Document BOM.

seg-source.mrk: As previously stated, the master BOM and checklist work together to form a configuration, which is used to produce the Document BOM.

trans-unit.source: Create Document BOM with Checklist and Master BOM

seg-source.mrk: Create Document BOM with Checklist and Master BOM

trans-unit.source: When using cc|configure to order functionality to create a BOM in the Job Budget Calculation, the Job Line BOM Control dialog does not appear because a BOM does not exist for the line until the Document BOM is created.

seg-source.mrk: When using cc|configure to order functionality to create a BOM in the Job Budget Calculation, the Job Line BOM Control dialog does not appear because a BOM does not exist for the line until the Document BOM is created.

trans-unit.source: The budget line will be populated with only the item. Notice that the Checklist No. field is populated as well; this is generated automatically from the Checklist assigned on the item.

field is populated as well; this is generated automatically from the Checklist assigned on the item.

trans-unit.source: On the ribbon, click Navigate > Checklist to open the Checklist.

trans-unit.source: Note

seg-source.mrk: Note

trans-unit.source: If the Open Immediately check box is selected in the Checklist Template, then the Checklist will open automatically when the Quantity field is populated.

trans-unit.source: : Checklist for job budget calculation line

trans-unit.source: Additional machine type components can be selected, a type of motor can be entered (kW power) and additional documentation can be included. For this example, no changes are made to the machine type, a power of 90 is entered and an English manual must also be included.

seg-source.mrk: Additional machine type components can be selected, a type of motor can be entered (kW power) and additional documentation can be included.
For this example, no changes are made to the machine type, a power of 90 is entered and an English manual must also be included.

trans-unit.source: The Checklist is completed by clicking OK.

seg-source.mrk: The Checklist is completed by clicking OK.

trans-unit.source: Before a Document BOM can be created, a quantity must be entered in the line. Then on the Navigate tab, click Document BOM to create the Document BOM. A message will appear if no Document BOM exists, asking to create a new Document BOM.

seg-source.mrk: Before a Document BOM can be created, a quantity must be entered in the line.
Then on the Navigate tab, click Document BOM to create the Document BOM.
A message will appear if no Document BOM exists, asking to create a new Document BOM.

trans-unit.source: : Message to create a new Document BOM

seg-source.mrk: : Message to create a new Document BOM

trans-unit.source: Click Yes to create the Document BOM. The Item - Master BOM page will open, displaying the related Master BOM. Click OK; the Document BOM page opens with the configuration from the Checklist, including the motor with 100 kW (based on settings in the Master BOM to choose this item if (POWER>=75) and (POWER<=100)) and the English documentation.

seg-source.mrk: Click Yes to create the Document BOM.
The Item - Master BOM page will open, displaying the related Master BOM.

Click OK; the Document BOM page opens with the configuration from the Checklist, including the motor with 100 kW (based on settings in the Master BOM to choose this item if (POWER>=75) and (POWER<=100)) and the English documentation.

trans-unit.source: Any changes that need to made to the Document BOM can be made here. If necessary, the original Document BOM can be recreated by deleting all existing lines in the Document BOM page and then running the "Request BOM" function from the ribbon.

trans-unit.source: Document BOMs with Master BOMs but without checklists can be used in the Job Budget Calculation line using the same process as with a checklist. When an item has no checklist, the Checklist No. field remains empty when the item is added to the Job Budget Calculation line.

When an item has no checklist, the Checklist No.
field remains empty when the item is added to the Job Budget Calculation line.

trans-unit.source: In the Job Budget Calculation line, enter a quantity and then click Navigate > Document BOM to create the Document BOM. Click OK; the Document BOM page opens.

seg-source.mrk: In the Job Budget Calculation line, enter a quantity and then click Navigate > Document BOM to create the Document BOM.

trans-unit.source: Processing Document BOMs in Job Budget and Planning Lines

seg-source.mrk: Processing Document BOMs in Job Budget and Planning Lines

trans-unit.source: The Document BOM is the base for exploding the Document BOM to the Job Budget Calculation line using the “Expand BOM” function or creating Production Orders in the Job Planning and Processing view. Each option is described in this section.

seg-source.mrk: The Document BOM is the base for exploding the Document BOM to the Job Budget Calculation line using the “Expand BOM” function or creating Production Orders in the Job Planning and Processing view.
Each option is described in this section.

trans-unit.source: Expand BOM

seg-source.mrk: Expand BOM

trans-unit.source: The “Expand BOM” function explodes the Document BOM in the Job Budget Calculation line so that regular budgeting and calculation processes can be completed.

seg-source.mrk: The “Expand BOM” function explodes the Document BOM in the Job Budget Calculation line so that regular budgeting and calculation processes can be completed.

trans-unit.source: With the Document BOM line selected to expand, click Actions > Expand BOM.

seg-source.mrk: With the Document BOM line selected to expand, click Actions > Expand BOM.

trans-unit.source: : Job Line BOM Control dialog set to explode the Document BOM

seg-source.mrk: : Job Line BOM Control dialog set to explode the Document BOM

trans-unit.source: Click OK to explode the Document BOM in the Job Budget Calculation line.

seg-source.mrk: Click OK to explode the Document BOM in the Job Budget Calculation line.

trans-unit.source: : Job Budget Calculation with exploded Document BOM

seg-source.mrk: : Job Budget Calculation with exploded Document BOM

trans-unit.source: Create Production Orders from Document BOM

seg-source.mrk: Create Production Orders from Document BOM

trans-unit.source: In the Job Planning and Procurement view, lines that have the Prod. Order from Document BOM check box selected will create production orders based on the Document BOM when the procurement processes are run. This process is done when a complete production order needs to be processed but the line was not exploded because the configuration is not used for calculation purposes in the Job Budget Calculation.

seg-source.mrk: In the Job Planning and Procurement view, lines that have the <span class="Bold">Prod.
Order from Document BOM check box selected will create production orders based on the Document BOM when the procurement processes are run.
This process is done when a complete production order needs to be processed but the line was not exploded because the configuration is not used for calculation purposes in the Job Budget Calculation.

trans-unit.source: : Job Planning and Processing line for production order created from Document BOM

seg-source.mrk: : Job Planning and Processing line for production order created from Document BOM

trans-unit.source: After planning and releasing, the Production Order is created based on the Document BOM.

seg-source.mrk: After planning and releasing, the Production Order is created based on the Document BOM.

trans-unit.source: : Production Order created from Document BOM in Job Planning and Processing view

seg-source.mrk: : Production Order created from Document BOM in Job Planning and Processing view

trans-unit.source: Note

seg-source.mrk: Note

trans-unit.source: To create Production Orders from Document BOMs, produced items that are part of a Master BOM must have a Routing at this time; however, it can be a dummy routing that does not include any routing lines.

seg-source.mrk: To create Production Orders from Document BOMs, produced items that are part of a Master BOM must have a Routing at this time; however, it can be a dummy routing that does not include any routing lines.

trans-unit.source: Create Construction Orders from Job Planning and Processing Line

seg-source.mrk: Create Construction Orders from Job Planning and Processing Line

trans-unit.source: In cc|configure to order, a company’s engineering or construction department can use the construction order for managing the BOM prior to manufacturing. Therefore, the construction order is considered the work order for the construction department. The design engineer has the option of modifying the document BOM created by sales or creating a new BOM. In this case, he or she has access to the checklist.

seg-source.mrk: In cc|configure to order, a company’s engineering or construction department can use the construction order for managing the BOM prior to manufacturing.
Therefore, the construction order is considered the work order for the construction department.
The design engineer has the option of modifying the document BOM created by sales or creating a new BOM.
In this case, he or she has access to the checklist.

trans-unit.source: In the Job Planning and Procurement view of cc|project, the Construction Order procurement channel provides the ability to create construction orders for the job lines outside of the Job Budget Calculation, which can then be transferred to the Production module. Document BOMs that exist for the job line will be transferred to the new Construction Order.

seg-source.mrk: In the Job Planning and Procurement view of cc|project, the Construction Order procurement channel provides the ability to create construction orders for the job lines outside of the Job Budget Calculation, which can then be transferred to the Production module.
Document BOMs that exist for the job line will be transferred to the new Construction Order.

trans-unit.source: : Job Planning and Processing line for construction order created from Document BOM

seg-source.mrk: : Job Planning and Processing line for construction order created from Document BOM

trans-unit.source: After planning and releasing, the Construction Order is created based on the Document BOM if one exists.

seg-source.mrk: After planning and releasing, the Construction Order is created based on the Document BOM if one exists.

trans-unit.source: : Construction Order created from Document BOM in Job Planning and Processing view

seg-source.mrk: : Construction Order created from Document BOM in Job Planning and Processing view

trans-unit.source: The Job FastTab in the Construction Order provides information specific to the related job.

seg-source.mrk: The Job FastTab in the Construction Order provides information specific to the related job.

trans-unit.source: If a Document BOM does not exist for the job line, one can be created from the Construction Order.

seg-source.mrk: If a Document BOM does not exist for the job line, one can be created from the Construction Order.

trans-unit.source: : Job Planning and Processing line for construction order created without Document BOM

seg-source.mrk: : Job Planning and Processing line for construction order created without Document BOM

trans-unit.source: In the Construction Order, use the “Request BOM” function to create the Construction BOM from the Master BOM assigned to the item.

seg-source.mrk: In the Construction Order, use the “Request BOM” function to create the Construction BOM from the Master BOM assigned to the item.

trans-unit.source: : Construction Order created without Document BOM in Job Planning and Processing view, requesting Master BOM

seg-source.mrk: : Construction Order created without Document BOM in Job Planning and Processing view, requesting Master BOM

trans-unit.source: Prototypes in Job Budget Calculation

seg-source.mrk: Prototypes in Job Budget Calculation

trans-unit.source: With the prototype creation function, it is possible to generate new items automatically and/or find already produced items based on their developments. Likewise, new variants of an item can be produced and/or reused.

seg-source.mrk: With the prototype creation function, it is possible to generate new items automatically and/or find already produced items based on their developments.
Likewise, new variants of an item can be produced and/or reused.

trans-unit.source: The creation of a prototype is part of the configuration feature of cc|configure to order and is used when opening a Master BOM in the Document BOMs and the Construction Orders. The prototype item or item variant is then transferred to the Job Budget Calculation.

seg-source.mrk: The creation of a prototype is part of the configuration feature of cc|configure to order and is used when opening a Master BOM in the Document BOMs and the Construction Orders.
The prototype item or item variant is then transferred to the Job Budget Calculation.

trans-unit.source: Prototype Setup

seg-source.mrk: Prototype Setup

trans-unit.source: First, an item card must be set up as a Prototype template (refer to Fig. 29). On the Config. to Order FastTab, select the Prototype check box to make the Prototype Type and Prototype No. Series fields editable.

seg-source.mrk: First, an item card must be set up as a Prototype template (refer to <MadCap:xref href="#:" class="Figure" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">Fig. 29</MadCap:xref>).
On the <span class="Bold">Config.
to Order FastTab, select the Prototype check box to make the Prototype Type and Prototype No.
Series fields editable.

trans-unit.source: The Prototype Type field determines whether a new item or a new variant of the item will be applied during the creation of a new characteristic of the prototype. In the Prototype No. Series field, enter the number series to be used for the new creation of items and/or variants as a copy of the prototype.

seg-source.mrk: The Prototype Type field determines whether a new item or a new variant of the item will be applied during the creation of a new characteristic of the prototype.
In the <span class="Bold">Prototype No.
Series field, enter the number series to be used for the new creation of items and/or variants as a copy of the prototype.

trans-unit.source: : Templates for Prototype item and variant

seg-source.mrk: : Templates for Prototype item and variant

trans-unit.source: Furthermore, attributes must be entered. During the calculation of the Document BOMs, the system checks whether an identical item and/or variant is already present or has to be created. It is important that the Relevant to Prototype check boxes are selected for the attributes, which are to be used for retrieving the prototypes.

seg-source.mrk: Furthermore, attributes must be entered.
During the calculation of the Document BOMs, the system checks whether an identical item and/or variant is already present or has to be created.
It is important that the Relevant to Prototype check boxes are selected for the attributes, which are to be used for retrieving the prototypes.

trans-unit.source: : Prototype Attribute Setup

seg-source.mrk: : Prototype Attribute Setup

trans-unit.source: In the Checklist and Master BOM, the attributes used to find an existing or create a new item/variant are defined. In this example, the POWER attribute is used to determine when a new item or variant is created or searched.

seg-source.mrk: In the Checklist and Master BOM, the attributes used to find an existing or create a new item/variant are defined.
In this example, the POWER attribute is used to determine when a new item or variant is created or searched.

trans-unit.source: : POWER attribute set in the Checklist

seg-source.mrk: : POWER attribute set in the Checklist

trans-unit.source: : POWER attribute set in a Master BOM of an item in the main Master BOM

seg-source.mrk: : POWER attribute set in a Master BOM of an item in the main Master BOM

trans-unit.source: Example – Prototype Item

seg-source.mrk: Example – Prototype Item

trans-unit.source: In this example, the Conveyor Machine has been set up as a prototype item based on the type of engine power needed. When this item is added to the Job Budget Calculation, a new item will be created or an existing prototype item will be used in either scenario:

seg-source.mrk: In this example, the Conveyor Machine has been set up as a prototype item based on the type of engine power needed.
When this item is added to the Job Budget Calculation, a new item will be created or an existing prototype item will be used in either scenario:

trans-unit.source: The power required is between 50 and 74 kW

seg-source.mrk: The power required is between 50 and 74 kW

trans-unit.source: The power required is between 75 and 100 kW

seg-source.mrk: The power required is between 75 and 100 kW

trans-unit.source: The prototype item is added to the Job Budget Calculation line.

seg-source.mrk: The prototype item is added to the Job Budget Calculation line.

trans-unit.source: : Prototype item added to Job Budget Calculation line

seg-source.mrk: : Prototype item added to Job Budget Calculation line

trans-unit.source: In the Checklist, the power is set to 54 in the Input field.

seg-source.mrk: In the Checklist, the power is set to 54 in the Input field.

trans-unit.source: : Checklist for prototype item

seg-source.mrk: : Checklist for prototype item

trans-unit.source: The Document BOM is opened for the Job Budget Calculation line. The item that corresponds to the input power of 54 (D-7011) is used in the Master BOM.

seg-source.mrk: The Document BOM is opened for the Job Budget Calculation line.
The item that corresponds to the input power of 54 (D-7011) is used in the Master BOM.

trans-unit.source: : Document BOM with motor based on 54 kW of power indicated in Checklist

seg-source.mrk: : Document BOM with motor based on 54 kW of power indicated in Checklist

trans-unit.source: When the Document BOM is closed, the prototype item number is replaced by a new item number in the Job Budget Calculation line because this is the first instance of the configuration of the Conveyor Machine.

seg-source.mrk: When the Document BOM is closed, the prototype item number is replaced by a new item number in the Job Budget Calculation line because this is the first instance of the configuration of the Conveyor Machine.

trans-unit.source: : New item number for prototype configuration in Job Budget Calculation line

seg-source.mrk: : New item number for prototype configuration in Job Budget Calculation line

trans-unit.source: If a prototype item is entered on the Job Budget Calculation line, and an existing item is found, the system will not recalculate the Master BOM. The Document BOM that is linked to the found prototype item will be copied.

seg-source.mrk: If a prototype item is entered on the Job Budget Calculation line, and an existing item is found, the system will not recalculate the Master BOM.
The Document BOM that is linked to the found prototype item will be copied.

trans-unit.source: In the Item Card for this new item, the related Document BOM is stored in the Configure to Order FastTab, as well as from which prototype item the new item was created.

seg-source.mrk: In the Item Card for this new item, the related Document BOM is stored in the Configure to Order FastTab, as well as from which prototype item the new item was created.

trans-unit.source: : Prototype item creation references in Item Card

seg-source.mrk: : Prototype item creation references in Item Card

trans-unit.source: If the prototype item had been created from a Construction Order, the Prototype BOM Type and Prototype BOM No. fields would display Construction Order and the Construction Order number, respectively.

seg-source.mrk: If the prototype item had been created from a Construction Order, the Prototype BOM Type and Prototype BOM No.
fields would display Construction Order and the Construction Order number, respectively.

trans-unit.source: Prototype Variant

seg-source.mrk: Prototype Variant

trans-unit.source: Prototype variants work the same as prototype items except that instead of creating a new item, item variants are created for the item. In the Item Card, the Prototype Type field is set to Variant and a number series for prototype variants is used (refer to Fig. 29).

seg-source.mrk: Prototype variants work the same as prototype items except that instead of creating a new item, item variants are created for the item.
In the Item Card, the Prototype Type field is set to Variant and a number series for prototype variants is used (refer to Fig. 29).

trans-unit.source: In the Job Budget Calculation, the prototype item variant is entered. Currently, the Variant Code field is empty.

seg-source.mrk: In the Job Budget Calculation, the prototype item variant is entered.
Currently, the Variant Code field is empty.

trans-unit.source: : Prototype item variant added to Job Budget Calculation line

seg-source.mrk: : Prototype item variant added to Job Budget Calculation line

trans-unit.source: In the Checklist, the power is set to 54 in the Input field.

seg-source.mrk: In the Checklist, the power is set to 54 in the Input field.

trans-unit.source: : Checklist for prototype item variant

seg-source.mrk: : Checklist for prototype item variant

trans-unit.source: The Document BOM is opened for the Job Budget Calculation line. The item that corresponds to the input power of 77 (D-7012) is used in the Master BOM.

seg-source.mrk: The Document BOM is opened for the Job Budget Calculation line.
The item that corresponds to the input power of 77 (D-7012) is used in the Master BOM.

trans-unit.source: : Document BOM with motor based on 77 kW of power indicated in Checklist

seg-source.mrk: : Document BOM with motor based on 77 kW of power indicated in Checklist

trans-unit.source: Since no variants exist for this configuration, a variant is added to the prototype item when the Document BOM is created. When the Document BOM is closed, the new variant is entered in the Variant Code field in the Job Budget Calculation line.

seg-source.mrk: Since no variants exist for this configuration, a variant is added to the prototype item when the Document BOM is created.
When the Document BOM is closed, the new variant is entered in the Variant Code field in the Job Budget Calculation line.

trans-unit.source: : New variant for prototype item configuration in Job Budget Calculation line

seg-source.mrk: : New variant for prototype item configuration in Job Budget Calculation line

trans-unit.source: If another line was added to the Job Budget Calculation for the same item using the same configuration, the same variant would be used. If another line was added to the Job Budget Calculation for the same item using a different configuration, a new variant would be created for the item and entered in the Job Budget Calculation line.

seg-source.mrk: If another line was added to the Job Budget Calculation for the same item using the same configuration, the same variant would be used.
If another line was added to the Job Budget Calculation for the same item using a different configuration, a new variant would be created for the item and entered in the Job Budget Calculation line.

trans-unit.source: In the prototype item, the Item Variants show the related Document BOM information.

seg-source.mrk: In the prototype item, the Item Variants show the related Document BOM information.

trans-unit.source: : Prototype item creation references in Item Card

seg-source.mrk: : Prototype item creation references in Item Card

trans-unit.source: If the prototype item variant had been created from a Construction Order, the Prototype BOM Type and Prototype BOM No. fields would display Construction Order and the Construction Order number, respectively.

seg-source.mrk: If the prototype item variant had been created from a Construction Order, the Prototype BOM Type and Prototype BOM No.
fields would display Construction Order and the Construction Order number, respectively.
